text: First time Sake drinker, picked this cuz I love fuj apples. Off white colour, smells very much green apple, tastes similar to a bite out of a fuj apple, perhaps a bit sweeter. I like it.
Sampled with a sake flight at a local Asian place. Fake green apple dominates. Like a green jolly rancher. Ok.

Crystal clear super pale yellow. Aroma is noticeable from over a foot away, with lots of candied apple and sugary hard candy. It basically smells like a green Jolly Rancher. Flavor is fruity and smooth with a gentle booziness throughout. Not much else to say, its like a imperial cider but without that annoying champagne yeastiness or too much bubbly. Pretty sweet but just shy of cloying.

This one poured a slightly cloudy white color with a touch of green tint in here. Aroma was light, sweet notes, notes of green apples here. Flavor was sweet apple notes, sugar character. Almost like a cider than a sake.

pours clear light yellow. Red apple and apple skin on the nose. Drinks with strong apple juice aroma up front, some woodiness, 5/10-sweetness, pear, medium sour backdrop, rice-alcohol off-dry, roughish ricey finish. Low-medium complexity, low-medium depth, decent transitions, okay carry, decent drinkability.

Bottle @ Home, courtesy of Henriksoegaard. Pours clear waterlike. Aroma of rice, apples, sweets, bubblegum. Flavor is very sweet with rice, green apples, bubblegum. Medium body, oily mouthfeel. 301212

Pour into glass, clear yellow pour with no head, aroma has notes of big sour pucker apple, some slight rice and white grape, with more sour fuji apple notes.  Taste is similar but much more restrained, some hints of white grape, rice and slight grainy notes with some apple, finishing fairly dry, slightly sweet.  Taste is much better than I expected from the aroma.

Bottle 750ml. @ [ T.S.H.R.B.G.S.C.S.M.T (The Second Handrup RateBeer Gathering Special Cider Sake Mead Tasting) - Ebeltoft ].Clear crystial clear water colour with a yellow note, with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy, rice, apple - pear, green apple, pepper. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and light light acidic with a long duration, tart apple - pear, artificial. Body is medium, texture is oily - watery, carbonation is flat. finish feel is light alcoholic. [20120414]
Bottle. Courtey Nisse666. Clear colour. Intense artificial apple aroma. Powerfuæll aplle flavor. Average finish. Oily palate.
Bottle. Clear as water with no head. Aroma is green apples, artificial and bublegum. Flavour is medium sweet, apple, artificial, warming and sugar.
White and clear as water. No head. Aroma of green apples, almost like apple-shampoo form the 80ties. Sweetness too. Flavor is heavy sweet, more apples. Syrupy texture. Flat.
Clear as water. Aroma is sweet, rice, artificial apple and Hubba Bubba apple chewing gum, that I used to eat as a kid. Flavor is quite sweet. Quite sweet finish with burning alcohol. 140412
green apple aroma,pale, light sweetness, medium body, oily feel, sweet apple finish.
Bottle. No head. Color is water. Aroma and taste are artificial green apple, rice malt and alcohol.

Bottle poured a clear white with no head (still). Aromas of sour apple, spice and white pepper. Palate was light bodied and smoth. Flavors of apple, cinnamon and light white pepper with a smooth lingering apple finish.
Very delicious stuff. The apple is strong, but not totally overpowering. An extremely refreshing daytime beverage.

My first sake and Im glad to see that this isnt a "true" sake. Aroma was very nice. Sour green apple with a hint of pineapple and water. Pour was a dirty clear green. Taste was a tad watery with sour apple and water being the only thing present. Sweet but thin aftertaste that finishes quickly. Tastes like one of those flavored waters that are on the market.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: (Sample Date: 5/2/2009   Source:Other)   Apple Flavored Sake. Apple sweetness in aroma - almost a stinkbug sweetness. Flavor is rubber band, apple. Finish is sweet with apple notes sticking around.

Bottle courtesy of dkachur on 05/02/2009. Clear off-white body with no head and light legs. Very sweet apple aroma with some light vanilla hints. Sweet, almost spicy, apple flavor with a bit of light vanilla. Medium light body with no carbonation.

Courtesy of maniac, my first infused sake, sampled at the end of the Big Brew Day in Beaverdam.  Fruity apple aroma.  Clear with what honesty looked to be a slight green tint.  Flavor was odd, sweet apple with a strange note of rubber.  This wasnt as bad as it would sound, but it was clearly a bit different.  But not bad.  I suspect that this might be not the most serious sake in the world.

750 mL bottle from Market Street Wineshop and Grocery, downtown location, Charlottesville, VA. Pours nearly clear with the faintest possible greenish tint. Aroma is pure tart green apple candy. Taste is a fresher seeming green apple (not so candy-like) and faint melon, caramel and rice notes. Sweet and sugary all the way through. Full bodied.

Bottle: Clear with no legs. Nose of green apple jolly ranchers, fresh pressed cider and some must. The flavor has some koji initially then apple extract, melon and some sweetness take over. Sweet, light body. Little sake if any.
